intro: Erythrostemon pannosus, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Erythrostemon pannosus is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
